narrative.title: 45Th Infantry Division - 1943Q2
narrative.situation: American Infantry Division deployed in North Africa during 1943Q2.
narrative.objectives: Combat-experienced US Infantry Division (triangular organization). Completed Tunisia Campaign with first combat victories. Role: assault division for Operation Husky (Sicily invasion, July 10, 1943). Division now rated 'Veteran' after 4 months of combat operations.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: Mixed: Tunisia coastal areas (April-May), then Algeria training areas (June) with amphibious training zones

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Amphibious assault trained for Sicily invasion
Strong unit morale after Tunisia victory

environment.terrain_type: Mixed: Tunisia coastal areas (April-May), then Algeria training areas (June) with amphibious training zones
